name: State_6

timeline_beats.label: Early coastal settlement and reef-harvesting culture
Integration into regional port networks (river & league era)
Devastation and territorial shifts during the Great Naval War
Reconstruction, entrance into maritime blocs and treaties

factions.label: Shipwright Guild
factions.influence_hint: Controls yards, licensing for large hulls and ritual fittings

factions.label: Maritime Merchant Houses
factions.influence_hint: Directs long-distance trade and reagent imports

factions.label: Coastal Nobility
factions.influence_hint: Holds shore rights, port dues and militia commissions

factions.label: Harborwatch
factions.influence_hint: Local naval militia, enforces embargoes and patrols reefs

traits: oral memorials of naval loss and valor

external_relations_refs.label_hint: Territorial Shifts after Great Naval War

constraints: No instant resurrection or life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is banned and rare
Navigational auguries do not replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialist labor
Combustion-derived heavy industry limited (no high-pressure steam megatech)
Treaty obligations under T1 and alliance commitments under A1 must be observed
Post-War border realities per BC4 constrain expansion along contested shoals
notes: Major ports rely on imported reagents for ritual boosts; supply vulnerability shapes policy
Shipwright Guild licensing required for vessels above a specified tonnage and for ritual fittings
Dense reef systems create navigational chokepoints and shape naval tactics
Harborwatch enforces embargoes tied to Merchant House disputes
Lower layers must model seasonal monsoon/tide cycles affecting trade windows
